summary: The "cosmetics industry" encompasses the production, distribution, and regulation of cosmetic products within the European Union. Governed by the EU Cosmetics Regulation (EC) No. 1223/2009, this sector is subject to stringent safety assessments, labeling requirements, and marketing standards to ensure consumer protection. The regulation mandates that all cosmetic products undergo rigorous testing for efficacy and safety, prohibiting harmful substances and ensuring transparency in ingredient disclosure. Additionally, the industry is closely monitored for compliance with environmental and ethical standards, promoting sustainable practices. This regulatory framework aims to foster innovation while safeguarding public health and consumer rights within the EU market.
